title: Group Product Manager, Payments
content:
Who We Are
At Justworks, you’ll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, great benefits, wellness program offerings, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from leaders in the startup community. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.
We’re helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues. We’re data-driven and never stop iterating. If you’d like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we’d love to hear from you.
We're united by shared goals and shared motivations at Justworks. These are best summed up in our company values, which are reflected in our product and in our team.
Our Values
If this sounds like you, you’ll fit right in.Who You Are
We are seeking a Group Product Manager (GPM) to transform Payments from a core competency into a productizable suite of capabilities. You have deep Payments industry experience, demonstrable financial acumen and a strong product vision informed by a depth of knowledge in fintech industry trends and trajectories. 
You have a passion for engendering organizational change through transformative software. You’re comfortable with ambiguity, and you’re ready to refine a strategy that includes building customer-facing Payments products, as well as creating the platforms, services, and APIs that will unlock opportunities across the business.   You know how to be an internal vendor and to provide service-oriented customer-support; but you also want to build virtual wallets, payments dashboards, and other financial solutions like earned-wage access.
As a strategic leader, you will define the vision and roadmap for a cluster of teams, bridging company mission and goals to develop a business rooted and user-centric roadmap. As a people leader, you will mentor other Product Managers and motivate your teams around a true north. As an executional leader, you will be accountable for the delivery of your team’s roadmap in collaboration with design, engineering and operations partners and with a bias toward short, iterative cycles of learning and value creation.
Your passion and expertise in Payments is unparalleled . Having learned the hard way that reconciliation and exception handling are just as important as RTP and FedNow, you know the devil’s in the details when it comes to money movement. You’re fully prepared to roll up your sleeves and dig into those details, leading both your reports and your scrum teams by example. You have strong technical acumen and experience with modern service-oriented and API architectures.
What You Will Work On

Partner with engineering, design and operations to set product vision and strategy for Payments at Justworks across the following three time horizons:

Over the next year you will evolve our Payments API and build embeddable experiences on top of it, creating compound value across a variety of standalone Justworks products using them
Over the next three years, you’ll own and drive the vision behind net-new revenue opportunities with Payments at their core
Over the next five years you’ll steer a broader vision for how Payments will mature to support the evolving needs of small businesses under 100

Build backend capabilities and end-to-end products with a clear point-of-view of what features should be embeddable vs. standalone vs. customer-facing
Drive adoption of APIs that will centralize money-movement across Justworks applications, working with internal customers to iterate in response to their feedback 
Develop a rigorous, data-driven product culture across a growing team, ensuring that craft is balanced with customer obsession and business orientation
Create frameworks for your cross-functional team to prioritize and execute against capabilities, end-user features and internal tools - balancing customer needs with business goals
Bring your solutions to market through ownership of the full product lifecycle: problem identification, solution design, spec, implementation and validation
Define and measure OKRs that align with Justworks’ broader business objectives
Create a cross-functional and collaborative development process optimized for your domain
Continuously prioritize needs of customers and internal stakeholders, and reassess as needed
Communicate product priorities to leadership and stakeholders across the organization, making the case with evidence-based decision making
Develop, mentor, and lead a dynamic team of Product Managers
Perform other related duties as assigned

How You Will Do Your Work
As a Group PM, how results are achieved is paramount for your success and ultimately result in our success as an organization. In this role, your foundational knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes are anchored in the following competencies:

Customer focus - You seek to deeply understand the jobs-to-be-done of your customers - internal and external - and can turn that understanding into customer-centric solutions.
Business insight - You think two months, two quarters, and two years into the future simultaneously. Your roadmaps help business leaders make effective decisions about tradeoffs and prioritization. 
Dynamic Range- You know the difference between competencies, capabilities, platforms, products, and businesses, but you love them all. You can stretch from a ten thousand foot view down to ground level.
Teamwork and communication - You work best in teams and forge them through relationship-building, listening, empathy and transparent, collaborative approaches.
Results-driven - You’re enthusiastic about data-driven performance, measurable OKRs, and meaningful KPIs. You consistently achieve results, even under difficult circumstances. You are comfortable executing at a fast pace and pushing legacy partners to meet that pace.

In addition, all Justworkers focus on aligning their behaviors to our core values known as COGIS. It stands for:

Camaraderie - Day to day you can be seen working together toward a higher purpose. You like to have fun. You’re an active listener, treat people respectfully, and have a strong desire to know and help others.
Openness - Your default is to be open. You're willing to share information, understand other perspectives, and consider new possibilities. You’re curious, ask open questions, and are receptive to thoughts and feedback from others.
Grit - You demonstrate grit by having the courage to commit and persevere. You’re committed, earnest, and dive in to get the job done well with a positive attitude.
Integrity - Simply put, do what you say and say what you'll do. You’re honest and forthright, have a strong moral compass, and strive to match your words with your actions while leading by example. 
Simplicity - Be like Einstein: “Everything should be made as simple as possible, but no simpler.” 

Qualifications

Minimum 10 years of work experience in product management or related technical leadership roles
Minimum 5 years in the Payments space with at least 3 years defining, building and integrating systems
Minimum 3 years experience managing a high performing team of Product Managers
Strong understanding of technical concepts including systems design, data architecture and the like
Proven ability to identify opportunities, form compelling business cases, and gain stakeholder buy-in
Experience evaluating build-buy-partner decisions, particularly in the Payments space
Experience working in a high growth, fast-scaling environment
Demonstrated ability to scale complicated systems
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams with competing priorities, stakeholders, and streams
Bonus points for depth of experience in… 

SaaS product life cycles
Serving SMBs as part of a direct or B2B2C model
Risk management and financial accounting


The base wage range for this position based in our New York City Office is targeted at $190,000.00 to $218,500.00 per year.
#LI-Hybrid #LI-SP1Actual compensation is based on multiple factors that are unique to each candidate, including and not limited to skill set, level of relevant experience, and specific work location.  Salary ranges for positions based in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. 
For more information about Justworks’ Total Reward Philosophy, including all of the perks and benefits we are proud to offer our team members, please visit Total Rewards @ Justworks. 
Diversity At Justworks
Justworks is committed to maintaining a workplace where diversity of identity, culture, and life experience is the norm and is celebrated authentically and respected consistently. Diversity in our work, our people, and our product drives creativity and innovation, entrepreneurial leadership and integrity, competitiveness, and collaboration throughout our business and in the market. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, our workplace more dynamic, and our product accessible to all of our customers.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or familial status, disability, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
Our DEIB Report and Our DEI Commitment

demographic_questions.description:
We work hard to reflect the world we want to see by leading with diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging (DEIB) principles and want to ensure that people from all backgrounds and experiences feel welcomed, supported, and empowered to potentially join the Justworks team.

We believe that in order to gather accurate demographic information we need to move beyond traditional questions about gender, race and ethnicity, and sexual orientation in favor of more inclusive and open-ended approaches.  Of course, thinking around these areas is ever-evolving so, wherever applicable please feel free to select "I prefer to self-describe" and then elaborate so we can use your feedback to inform survey selections in the future.

Participation in this survey is completely optional. Any responses you choose to share will not be associated with your application and will not in any way be used in any hiring decision.  We are collecting this information to establish a better understanding of our candidate pool and meet commitments related to DEIB as we seek to be representative of the wider world.

At Justworks, we are building an open, inclusive, and collaborative culture that values people and their individual potential in the collective service of our company, our community, and our customers. Our DEIB mission is to help every Justworker grow with confidence and realize their full potential.  

We are leading the industry by transparently holding ourselves accountable for our representation and culture of inclusion by sharing our progress. Starting in 2022, we are releasing DEIB statistics on an annual basis. We know we can always do more to advance DEIB, but we are also proud of the company we are building, one great Justworker at a time.
